revised_title: Hydrocarbon Researches and the Diaphragm's Role in Respiration
tldr: This article discusses the author's research on hydrocarbons in the series CnH2n+2 and the role of the diaphragm in respiration. The author presents new findings on normal paraffins and their boiling points, as well as a detailed analysis of the diaphragm's function in relation to other muscles and the chest wall. The author challenges the prevailing opinions on abdominal and thoracic breathing in males and females.
